alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 4:19AM CST until January 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM FRIDAY TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to three inches. Isolated areas of up to four inches are possible. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. The potential for localized snow squalls on Friday afternoon along the Interstate 80 corridor could reduce visibility below one mile at times. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 30 to 40 below zero. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Banner County, Kimball County and Cheyenne County. In Wyoming, East Laramie County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 AM Friday to 5 PM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday afternoon through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
